Key Match Events: Cubs starter Kyle Hendricks gave up a game-tying solo home run to Bryan Reynolds in the bottom of the 1st
Christian Bethancourt cut the margin to 10-5 when he blasted a two-run homer against Kyle Nicolas in the 7th
Christian Bethancourt lined a go-ahead two-run single past third base to give the North Siders an 11-10 advantage
Happ, Mike Tauchman, and Seiya Suzuki each singling home runs off of Jalen Beeks to make it a 14-10 advantage
Post-Match Reflections: The Cubs scored a whopping 41 runs over the three games of this sweep
Sometimes dramatic wins like this one can spark a run, and this definitely provides a flicker of hope
Things might get very interesting if they can keep rolling against Washington
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pittsburgh closer David Bednar got into a jam with a pair of singles and a walk loading the bases with one out
The Pirates had the bases loaded twice in the late innings and were not able to add any insurance
Cody Bellinger began the scoring against ace Paul Skenes with a run-scoring single in the top of the 1st
PCA was perfect on the afternoon with four hits, a walk, and four runs scored
Happ also got on base five times Wednesday as he continues to dominate in Pittsburgh
